intro: Adenocarpus complicatus subsp. cebennensis, commonly known as the Cebenna burrweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy, and often branched pods. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, yellow flowers are followed by the characteristic burr-like fruits that aid in seed dispersal. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters.
